instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MacBook Pro 2017 with NAND damage
threads.message: I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board that has physical damage to two NAND chips and needs replacements from a donor board. This is a T1 machine; do I need to replace all 4 NAND chips or can I just transplant the 2 damaged ones?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MacBook Pro 2017 with NAND damage
threads.message:
Replace the burnt chips and test.
It should work...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MacBook Pro 2017 with NAND damage
threads.message: Also, would you recommend cleaning up all the black underfill from the board, or just placing the reballed chips on top of it, trusting that the balls will make contact? See photo.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MacBook Pro 2017 with NAND damage
threads.message:
Clean that; be sure to get good solders.
Many videos available on Internet, about changing NANDs...
